sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The Sys.GetComputerName function is used to determine the name of the computer. On the PC, this is the NetBIOS name. It returns “No Name” if a name could not be determined.
sections.text_content: The Sys.GetComputerName function is used to determine the name of the computer. On the PC, this is the NetBIOS name. It returns No Name if a name could not be determined.
sections.mdown_content: The **Sys.GetComputerName** function is used to determine the name of the computer. On the PC, this is the NetBIOS name. It returns “No Name” if a name could not be determined.

sections.title: Example
code:
var computerName, userName : string
        computerName := Sys.GetComputerName
        userName := Sys.GetUserName
        put "Hello ", userName, " on ", computerName
sections.raw_content: This program outputs a greeting to the user .
sections.text_content: This program outputs a greeting to the user .
sections.mdown_content: This program outputs a greeting to the user .

sections.title: Status
sections.raw_content:
Exported qualified.

This means that you can only call the function by calling Sys. GetComputerName, not by calling GetComputerName.
sections.text_content:
Exported qualified.
This means that you can only call the function by calling Sys. GetComputerName, not by calling GetComputerName.
sections.mdown_content:
Exported qualified.

This means that you can only call the function by calling **Sys. GetComputerName**, not by calling **GetComputerName**.

sections.title: See also
sections.raw_content: Sys.GetUserName to obtain the user name of the user currently logged in.
sections.text_content: Sys.GetUserName to obtain the user name of the user currently logged in.
sections.mdown_content: **[Sys.GetUserName](sys_getusername.html)** to obtain the user name of the user currently logged in.
